db:abstract.db:para: The QMediaRecorder class is used for the recording of media content.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The QMediaRecorder class is a high level media recording class. It's not intended to be used alone but for accessing the media recording functions of other media objects, like QRadioTuner, or QCamera.

db:td.db:para: Device is not ready or not available.
The recorder is not available or not supported by connected media object.
The recorder is avilable but not loaded.
The recorder is initialized and ready to record media.
Recording is requested but not active yet.
Recording is stopped with media being finalized.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] actualLocation : const QUrl
db:section.db:para: This property holds the actual location of the last media content.
The actual location is usually available after recording starts, and reset when new location is set or new recording starts.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] duration : const qint64
db:section.db:para: This property holds the recorded media duration in milliseconds.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] metaDataAvailable : const bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether access to a media object's meta-data is available.
If this is true there is meta-data available, otherwise there is no meta-data available.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] metaDataWritable : const bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether a media object's meta-data is writable.
If this is true the meta-data is writable, otherwise the meta-data is read-only.

db:section.db:title: muted : bool
db:section.db:para: This property holds whether a recording audio stream is muted.

db:section.db:title: outputLocation : QUrl
db:section.db:para: This property holds the destination location of media content.

Setting the location can fail, for example when the service supports only local file system locations but a network URL was passed. If the service does not support media recording this setting the output location will always fail.

The location can be relative or empty; in this case the recorder uses the system specific place and file naming scheme. After recording has stated, QMediaRecorder::outputLocation() returns the actual output location.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] state : const QMediaRecorder::State
db:section.db:para: This property holds the current state of the media recorder.
The state property represents the user request and is changed synchronously during record(), pause() or stop() calls. Recorder state may also change asynchronously when recording fails.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] status : const QMediaRecorder::Status
db:section.db:para: This property holds the current status of the media recorder.
The status is changed asynchronously and represents the actual status of media recorder.

db:section.db:title: volume : qreal
db:section.db:para: This property holds the linear audio gain of media recorder.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QMediaRecorder::QMediaRecorder(QMediaObject *mediaObject, QObject *parent = Q_NULLPTR)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a media recorder which records the media produced by mediaObject.
The parent is passed to QMediaObject.

db:section.db:title: [virtual noexcept] QMediaRecorder::~QMediaRecorder()
db:section.db:para: Destroys a media recorder object.

db:section.db:title: void QMediaRecorder::actualLocationChanged(const QUrl &location)
db:section.db:para: Signals that the actual location of the recorded media has changed. This signal is usually emitted when recording starts.

db:section.db:title: QString QMediaRecorder::audioCodecDescription(const QString &codec) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a description of an audio codec.

db:section.db:title: QAudioEncoderSettings QMediaRecorder::audioSettings() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the audio encoder settings being used.

db:section.db:title: QMultimedia::AvailabilityStatus QMediaRecorder::availability() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the availability of this functionality.

db:section.db:title: void QMediaRecorder::availabilityChanged(QMultimedia::AvailabilityStatus availability)
db:section.db:para: Signals that the service availability has changed to availability.

db:section.db:title: void QMediaRecorder::availabilityChanged(bool available)
db:section.db:para: Signals that the media recorder is now available (if available is true), or not.

db:section.db:title: QStringList QMediaRecorder::availableMetaData() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a list of keys there is meta-data available for.

db:section.db:title: QString QMediaRecorder::containerDescription(const QString &format) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a description of a container format.

db:section.db:title: QString QMediaRecorder::containerFormat() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the selected container format.

db:section.db:title: void QMediaRecorder::durationChanged(qint64 duration)
db:section.db:para: Signals that the duration of the recorded media has changed.

db:section.db:title: QMediaRecorder::Error QMediaRecorder::error() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the current error state.

db:section.db:title: void QMediaRecorder::error(QMediaRecorder::Error error)
db:section.db:para: Signals that an error has occurred.

db:section.db:title: QString QMediaRecorder::errorString() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a string describing the current error state.

db:section.db:title: bool QMediaRecorder::isAvailable() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if media recorder service ready to use.

db:section.db:title: [override virtual] QMediaObject *QMediaRecorder::mediaObject() const
db:section.db:para: Reimplements: QMediaBindableInterface::mediaObject() const.
Returns the QMediaObject instance that this QMediaRecorder is bound too, or 0 otherwise.

db:section.db:title: QVariant QMediaRecorder::metaData(const QString &key) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the value associated with a meta-data key.

db:section.db:title: void QMediaRecorder::metaDataAvailableChanged(bool available)
db:section.db:para: Signals that the available state of a media object's meta-data has changed.

db:section.db:title: void QMediaRecorder::metaDataChanged()
db:section.db:para: Signals that a media object's meta-data has changed.
If multiple meta-data elements are changed, metaDataChanged(const QString &key, const QVariant &value) signal is emitted for each of them with metaDataChanged() changed emitted once.

db:section.db:title: void QMediaRecorder::metaDataChanged(const QString &key, const QVariant &value)
db:section.db:para: Signal the changes of one meta-data element value with the given key.

db:section.db:title: void QMediaRecorder::metaDataWritableChanged(bool writable)
db:section.db:para: Signals that the writable state of a media object's meta-data has changed.

db:section.db:title: void QMediaRecorder::mutedChanged(bool muted)
db:section.db:para: Signals that the muted state has changed. If true the recording is being muted.

db:section.db:title: void QMediaRecorder::pause()
db:section.db:para: Pause recording.
The recorder state is changed to QMediaRecorder::PausedState.
Depending on platform recording pause may be not supported, in this case the recorder state stays unchanged.

db:section.db:title: void QMediaRecorder::record()
db:section.db:para: Start recording.

While the recorder state is changed immediately to QMediaRecorder::RecordingState, recording may start asynchronously, with statusChanged(QMediaRecorder::RecordingStatus) signal emitted when recording starts.
If recording fails error() signal is emitted with recorder state being reset back to QMediaRecorder::StoppedState.

db:section.db:title: void QMediaRecorder::setAudioSettings(const QAudioEncoderSettings &settings)
db:section.db:para: Sets the audio encoder settings.
If some parameters are not specified, or null settings are passed, the encoder will choose default encoding parameters, depending on media source properties.
It's only possible to change settings when the encoder is in the QMediaEncoder::StoppedState state.

db:section.db:title: void QMediaRecorder::setContainerFormat(const QString &container)
db:section.db:para: Sets the media container format.
If the container format is not specified, the encoder will choose format, depending on media source properties and encoding settings selected.
It's only possible to change settings when the encoder is in the QMediaEncoder::StoppedState state.

db:section.db:title: void QMediaRecorder::setEncodingSettings(const QAudioEncoderSettings &audio, const QVideoEncoderSettings &video = QVideoEncoderSettings(), const QString &container = QString())
db:section.db:para: Sets the audio and video encoder settings and container format.
If some parameters are not specified, or null settings are passed, the encoder will choose default encoding parameters, depending on media source properties.
It's only possible to change settings when the encoder is in the QMediaEncoder::StoppedState state.

db:section.db:title: void QMediaRecorder::setMetaData(const QString &key, const QVariant &value)
db:section.db:para: Sets a value for a meta-data key.

db:note.db:para: To ensure that meta data is set corretly, it should be set before starting the recording. Once the recording is stopped, any meta data set will be attached to the next recording.

db:section.db:title: void QMediaRecorder::setVideoSettings(const QVideoEncoderSettings &settings)
db:section.db:para: Sets the video encoder settings.
If some parameters are not specified, or null settings are passed, the encoder will choose default encoding parameters, depending on media source properties.
It's only possible to change settings when the encoder is in the QMediaEncoder::StoppedState state.

db:section.db:title: QMediaRecorder::State QMediaRecorder::state() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the current media recorder state.

db:section.db:title: void QMediaRecorder::stateChanged(QMediaRecorder::State state)
db:section.db:para: Signals that a media recorder's state has changed.

db:section.db:title: QMediaRecorder::Status QMediaRecorder::status() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the current media recorder status.

db:section.db:title: void QMediaRecorder::stop()
db:section.db:para: Stop recording.
The recorder state is changed to QMediaRecorder::StoppedState.

db:section.db:title: QStringList QMediaRecorder::supportedAudioCodecs() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a list of supported audio codecs.

db:section.db:title: QList<int> QMediaRecorder::supportedAudioSampleRates(const QAudioEncoderSettings &settings = QAudioEncoderSettings(), bool *continuous = Q_NULLPTR) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a list of supported audio sample rates.
If non null audio settings parameter is passed, the returned list is reduced to sample rates supported with partial settings applied.
This can be used to query the list of sample rates, supported by specific audio codec.
If the encoder supports arbitrary sample rates within the supported rates range, *continuous is set to true, otherwise *continuous is set to false.

db:section.db:title: QStringList QMediaRecorder::supportedContainers() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a list of supported container formats.

db:section.db:title: QList<qreal> QMediaRecorder::supportedFrameRates(const QVideoEncoderSettings &settings = QVideoEncoderSettings(), bool *continuous = Q_NULLPTR) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a list of frame rates video can be encoded at.
If non null video settings parameter is passed, the returned list is reduced to frame rates supported with partial settings like video codec or resolution applied.
If the encoder supports arbitrary frame rates within the supported range, *continuous is set to true, otherwise *continuous is set to false.

db:section.db:title: QList<QSize> QMediaRecorder::supportedResolutions(const QVideoEncoderSettings &settings = QVideoEncoderSettings(), bool *continuous = Q_NULLPTR) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a list of resolutions video can be encoded at.
If non null video settings parameter is passed, the returned list is reduced to resolution supported with partial settings like video codec or framerate applied.
If the encoder supports arbitrary resolutions within the supported range, *continuous is set to true, otherwise *continuous is set to false.

db:section.db:title: QStringList QMediaRecorder::supportedVideoCodecs() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a list of supported video codecs.

db:section.db:title: QString QMediaRecorder::videoCodecDescription(const QString &codec) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a description of a video codec.

db:section.db:title: QVideoEncoderSettings QMediaRecorder::videoSettings() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the video encoder settings being used.
